content.raw:
I believe `.rst` stands for `reStructuredText` which seems to be the markdown format of cmake files.

I borrowed this file pattern from some official cmake modules (start with `.rst`, state the name of the module, state its purpose, show its license). I got somewhat lazy with the other modules and just put their license at the top and didn't bother with stating the module name or its purpose. If anyone has an opinion on which style is better, I'd be happy to change everything to be consistent.
